answers.answer: Hi,I am not too much of a snacker.  However, when I do feel the need my favorites are:-- Coffee with cream (no sugar)- herbal or plain teas- Nuts (in moderation)- Cheese- Carrot or celery sticks.- Boiled eggs- Cold meats (left overs)

We have lots of great suggestions for healthy, diabetes-friendly snacks in the Sugar Sense app and on MedHelp.org:http://www.medhelp.org/diabetes/slideshows/Diabetes-Friendly-Snacks/187/1http://www.medhelp.org/diabetes/articles/Different-Snacks-for-Different-Times/2286http://www.medhelp.org/nutrition/articles/4-Filling-100-Calorie-Snacks/2435http://www.medhelp.org/nutrition/articles/Smart-Snack-Swaps-for-Diabetes/2522As well as suggestions for things to do before you snack:http://www.medhelp.org/healthy-living/articles/5-Healthy-Alternatives-to-Snacking/2361You can find these in the app by going to the menu in the upper left hand corner, selecting the Health Guide, and navigating to the Eat Right section.

Nuts, cheese, cottage cheese, olives, yogurt (plain or the ones that are low sugar- you have to watch those carefully), lunch meats.  In the past I used to make sugar free cookies to eat with sugar replacement- stevia was one that I found to be good as you have to be careful with sugar replacements as well.

question: What are some great snacks to eat that will not make your blood sugars go crazy high?
title: Snack ideas
